channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Q&A: The Migrant Crisis in Europe: Readers’ Questions Answered
item.description: New York Times correspondents and editors answer readers questions about the European migrant crisis. Submit your questions.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: Migrants arrived Friday on the Greek island of Lesbos, after crossing from Turkey in a rubber raft.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Documentary to Feature Hong Kong Democracy Protests
item.description: “Freedom for the Wolf,” set for release next year, features the demonstrations as an essential part of a global struggle against the rise of “illiberal democracy” — what the director calls “voting without rights.”
item.dc:creator: MIKE FORSYTHE

item.title: Xi Jinping Vows to ‘Reaffirm’ China’s Commitment to Women’s Rights
item.description: The Chinese president’s remarks came at a United Nations conference Sunday where world leaders promised to change their laws and practices to advance gender equality.
item.category: United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: Xi Jinping Seeking to Secure Respect for China in U.N. Address
item.description: A New York Times correspondent looks at the message that the Chinese president is expected to share with the United Nations General Assembly on Monday.
item.dc:creator: JANE PERLEZ
item.media:description: President Xi Jinping of China at a joint news conference with President Obama in the Rose Garden of the White House on Friday.

item.title: A Warm Welcome Expected at U.N. for Hassan Rouhani of Iran
item.description: A look at what message can be expected from the Iranian president at the United Nations General Assembly on Monday.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ERDBRINK
item.media:description: President Hassan Rouhani of Iran during a news conference in Tehran last month.

item.title: Dilma Rousseff of Brazil Brings Many Objectives to the U.N.
item.description: The Times’s Rio de Janeiro bureau chief looks at the Brazilian president’s message for international leaders and how it might be received.
item.dc:creator: SIMON ROMERO

item.title: At U.N., François Hollande Is Likely to Focus on Climate
item.description: An address on Monday to the General Assembly will provide an opportunity for the French president to set the stage for a climate conference in Paris.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ALISSA J. RUBIN
item.media:description: President François Hollande of France is likely to touch only briefly on the subject of refugees in his message to the United Nations General Assembly on Monday.

item.title: Vladimir Putin of Russia to Focus on Syria at U.N.
item.description: President Vladimir V. Putin is expected to explain his proposal for a broad international coalition to fight the Islamic State threat in the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:description: President Vladimir V. Putin will be speaking at the United Nations General Assembly for the first time in 10 years.

item.title: Iraq Agrees to Share Intelligence on ISIS With Russia, Syria and Iran
item.description: The Iraqi military said in a statement that the new agreement was necessary because thousands of volunteers who have joined the Islamic State have come from Russia.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry with Sergey V. Lavrov, the Russian foreign minister, on Sunday.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Sri Lanka’s War Crimes Controversy
item.description: The U.N. recommended creating a special war crimes court, but even backers turned away, for fear of unsettling the new pro-Western government.
item.dc:creator: NILAN FERNANDO

item.title: France Says It Has Struck at ISIS in Syria
item.description: President François Hollande said in a statement that the airstrikes were coordinated with other nations battling the extremist group but gave few other details.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: AURELIEN BREEDEN

item.title: Earlston Journal: Scottish Village to Commemorate Ancestral Ties to Renowned Russian Poet
item.description: A bronze statue of Mikhail Lermontov, whose verse is considered by many Russians as second only to Aleksandr Pushkin’s, will be unveiled on Earlston’s tidy village green.
item.dc:creator: STEPHEN CASTLE
item.media:credit: Andrew Testa for The New York Times
item.media:description: The bronze bust of Mikhail Lermontov that will be unveiled on the village green in Earlston, Scotland.

item.title: Catalan Vote Seen as Referendum on Secession From Spain
item.description: The vote was expected to confirm separatist parties as the main political force in Catalonia.
item.dc:creator: RAPHAEL MINDER
item.media:description: A man counts ballots in Barcelona.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Hong Kong’s Umbrella Revolution: One Year Later
item.description: A year later, the people of Hong Kong are still debating the pro-democracy demonstrations that roiled the city for weeks.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY and ALAN WONG
item.media:description: Protesters calling for open elections sang and waved their cellphones after a thunderstorm passed overhead outside the Hong Kong government headquarters on Sept. 30, 2014.

item.title: President Xi Jinping of China Pledges $2 Billion to Fight Poverty
item.description: Mr. Xi told the United Nations that China would pledge $2 billion as an initial investment for development assistance to the poorest countries.
item.dc:creator: JANE PERLEZ

item.title: Partnership Aims to Bolster Local Health Care Providers
item.description: A collaboration of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, the World Bank and the World Health Organization will focus on medical care in poor and middle-income countries.
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:description: Bill Gates, right, and Melinda Gates at the United Nations on Friday. Their foundation is part of the new health care effort.

item.title: Cease-Fire Broken in Northwestern Syria, Monitor Says
item.description: A ceasefire in northwest Syria, part of a wider deal that included cessation of hostilities in the area as well as in a town near the Lebanese border, was broken late on Saturday, a monitoring group said.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Russia and Estonia Swap Prisoners Accused of Spying
item.description: Russia’s Federal Security Service said it handed over an Estonian security officer detained by Russia last year in exchange for a former Estonian official who was arrested in 2012.
item.dc:creator: RICHARD MARTYN-HEMPHILL and SOPHIA KISHKOVSKY

item.title: U.N. Summit Meeting on Women’s Rights Highlights More Tension Between U.S. and China
item.description: President Xi Jinping of China is a co-host of the meeting, even though his country imprisoned five feminists this year, and President Obama will not attend.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:description: The opening ceremony for a groundbreaking conference on women’s rights in 1995 in Beijing. On its 20th anniversary, a summit meeting is planned in New York.

item.title: Canada Revokes Citizenship of Bomb Plot Organizer
item.description: A controversial new law was used to strip the citizenship of Zakaria Amara, who is serving a life sentence for his role in a failed 2006 bombing plot in Toronto.
item.dc:creator: IAN AUSTEN
